reviews.review_msg: Midterm average was 47% 15/45 passed. During the final exam he and the TA laughed out loud about students exams that were just handed in. Right in front of those still writing ( literally pointed at a question and said that it was supposed to be easy while laughing).

SO MONOTONE. MT was 47% avg asked if we could get part marks for some questions, was told Dr Hutter does not believe in part marks :D No clear criteria on how we were being marked
Just stay the extra semester if you need to, not worth getting a hit to ur GPA. If u think it'll be different when u take it, no it won't,TRUST

This man goes a million miles an hour (you write a sentence and look up and he's 10 slides ahead), doesn't properly explain fundamental concepts, teaches the course in a confusing and convoluted order, and doesn't explain his grading scheme well. The class average on the midterm was 47% and this is a class of all biology major students! Never again

Dr. Hutter is an approachable, friendly, and patient professor. However, his lecture recordings were extremely unclear and hard to follow, especially towards the end of the course. His exams were extremely difficult and seemed to ask questions beyond the realm of what we undergrad students were able to understand.

This class was quite difficult, as their was a lot material in each lecture, but the slides were also quite bare so it is important to attend the lectures. His exams and quizzes were fair, but also quite difficult. Overall, he did a great job teaching the course and I would recommend you take this course with him.

Dr. Hutters lectures are informative and contains all the information you need to know without going into too much details. The materials for this course is difficult on its own, but his teaching style makes it easy to understand. Harald is a very nice and caring person so if you are having trouble, talk to him and he will help you!

AVOID IF YOU CAN!!! Very dull, monotonous lectures crammed with extra info not in the textbook, but expected to know. Condescending and dismissive. Expected us to complete a midterm in 45 minutes, which the entire class took 5 hr+ & had a low average. Made course harder than it needed to be, expects students to have PhD level of knowledge on topic.
Monotoned and lecture slides contains just bare minimum. Makes you feel dumb for asking questions and doesn't provide a straight answer.

Harald is a good prof. He's a fair marker and his lectures are very clear. He has many quizzes that sort of just appear throughout the semester (usually a week in advance). Watch out for those quizzes, they can be quite tricky. His exams are longer but straightforward. Really funny guy, says "idk" a lot and basically called a study trash in lecture
great prof. exams are fair, available to help. Took other classes with him because I enjoy his teaching style.
He is very monotonous. It is really hard to follow along in the class. The concepts are hard and he barely explained things in detail. The class was not structured well either. Would not recommend.

Harald was a great prof, although a very monotone lecturer, the course content is very interesting and his lecture notes have the information that you need for exams, and he was very clear to students what would be examinable and what wasn't. The textbook is only recommended but I found it really helpful for the final that was 60%.

Harald was not bad. I found him to be a very monotone speaker so lectures were always a bit dry, but he did present the information in new and interesting ways which kept them engaging. The final was worth 60% of the overall grade which was nervewrecking but he provided lots of feedback, resources, and clear grading criteria so the class was good!

He was amazing and understanding. It was very lecture heavy and he told you all the information you needed to know. He provided chapters to read from the textbooks but it was not required. His notes were a little bare boned and hard to understand so you have to attend class to understand. He gave us everything to succeed and guided our focus.

All in all a pretty good experience with this class. Make sure you come to lecture as his lecture notes are just pictures without context. This is not an easy class but he does a pretty good job explaining concepts. you get a free 15% for weekly assignment completion and Iclicker. The course was fairly interesting as well, would recommend.

Whie his lecture notes are not super clear, Harald Hutter is very approachable and does his best to make sure students understand. His tests are fair and does not throw curve balls. If you read the textbook or study in advance you will do well. Be sure to go to the TA's for challenging concepts!

This is not an easy class by any means but I love the way that Dr. Hutter teaches. He doesn't care if you know the small details, his goal is for you to understand the big picture. He doesn't have office hours but the TA for my course (Zeena) was unbelievably helpful because he is very clear with her what he wants from us.

Great prof and does his best teaching a class that has a large learning curve.  Tutorials and the TA were very helpful and free marks to boost you're grade.  Definitely had to use the text book.  Focus on what he tells you is important because there's a lot of material but a lot of it is not tested.

Harald's voice is very monotone making it difficult to pay attention in class. His final is worth 60% and the first midterm was difficult as his questions are solely conceptual. Would not recommend taking the course with him.
As long as you know and understand the material you will be good. Exams are fair and not tricky, lot of memorization but interesting course.

A teacher who listens to his students. Many kids failed his midterm in my class, and it tried his best to make it easier for them to get a great mark. Went out of his way to make the course easier and the final was stupidly easy. Excellent professor who listens to feedback and cares about his students.

Nice guy, but simply has no idea really of how to teach. Lectures, notes and the textbook do not confer a level of understanding necessary to do well on the exams. Furthermore his exams are solely conceptual, yet he spends most of his time harping on useless facts during lecture. I would not recommend this class for anybody who doesn't need it!
When I had him as a professor, I found him to be very monotone, therefore his lectures were pretty boring. He was quite vague, assigning super hard questions, and the TAs were bloody awful.

His midterm was fair, but his final was tough! There were some questions which were abstract and required a lot of thinking. Still fair though even though it was worth 60%. I would recommend him to anyone! I find him funny, nice, and love how he is always open to suggestions on improving the course. Great guy, great TA's! Thanks Dr. Hutter!

I like this guy! He's very funny and friendly. One thing that I really liked was how he always told us interesting articles and facts to connect to the course content. He's a bit monotone, but if you actually listen to him the things he says are really interesting and funny. His lecture slides needs a bit more detail, but his midterm is very fair.

Great professor! Try to pay attention to his lecture.  He speaks in a very boring tone but if you actually listen to what he says its really interesting and informative.  Exams are fair and he does tend to tell you exactly what he'll ask. His notes are very useful and barely read the textbook and just used his notes to study.
Nervous system development was a great course and Dr. Hutter was awesome! The lectures were interesting and the exams were fair. He is approachable. Highly recommend this course and the prof.
Great Prof!! Lectures are a little boring, but exams are FAIR! Very approachable!

Nervous system development was just an offshoot of his 333 - lots of the same slides. He can put you to sleep but just have a coffee before class cause what he says is very helpful. Exams are fair and based off the notes.

The lectures were okay but the notes were great.  I recommend going through the figure captions in the text book (as the figures in his notes are all out of the text) if things are a little confusing.  The tutorials were very useful and definitely worth attending (plus a big chunk of my grade was on homework completion, you just have to try!)

Dr. Hutter's lectures can be boring due to his monotone voice but his notes are very clear and detailed. His exams are quite fair (he tells you pretty much what questions he is likely to ask) and they come straight out of the lecture notes and problem sets.
Disastrous class! Monotone lectures were very hard to understand. Notes are dry & unclear, and the material itself is quite difficult...plus he's no help.
No Comments
No Comments

Textbook needed b/c notes are scattered! Monotone voice. Tough midterms due to vague questions and an incredibly strict marking criteria. So unless you're a psychic: good luck deciding what he wants as an answer! Spent a whole lecture telling us that without understanding the material we will continue to do badly on his exams. Quite condescending.
